relation: The path the user specified as the Oracle instance.
The type of the component being introspected.
The name of the component being introspected.
The path to the Oracle home related to this Oracle instance.
The path to the Java home used by this Oracle instance.

This is the password hash as it exists for this Oracle Web Cache instance. The deployed system uses this value unless you specifically set the value of the 'adminPassword' user property. The default value is the hashed password from the existing Oracle Web Cache configuration for the 'MONITORING' password hash.
This is the value of the password hash from the existing Oracle Web Cache configuration for the 'INVALIDATION' password hash.
The directory used by Oracle Universal Installer for installation files.
pageTitle: Oracle Virtual Assembly Builder Introspection Plug-ins
textBeforeTable: Table B-22 Oracle Web Cache: System Properties Table B-22 describes Oracle Web Cache appliance system properties. The port value for the site definition. <read from file> false String siteX-PORT The host name for the site definition. <read from file> false String siteX-HOST Sets the polling period, in seconds. 5 false Integer readymetric.pollingPeriod Sets the timeout duration, in seconds. 300 false Integer readymetric.timeout The password to use for the INVALIDATION password. If not specified, the system property originalStatisticsPassword will be used. none false String statisticsPassword
textAfterTable: B.4.9 Extensions of the Plug-in None. B.4.10 Supported Template Types The supported template type is Oracle Enterprise Linux (OEL). B.5 Oracle Database Plug-in The single-instance Oracle Database introspection plug-in examines a single-instance Oracle Database component and captures its metadata. B.5.1 Versions Supported This plug-in supports versions 10gR2, 11gR1, and 11gR2 B.5.2 Oracle Database Introspection Parameters Table B-23 lists the introspection parameters for Oracle Database: Table B-23 Oracle Database Plug-in Introspection Parameters Parameter Description dataFileDir Optional. The full path of the database files. This parameter is required if your database file directory is different from the default. Default value: DB 10.2 release: <Parent directory of $ORACLE_HOME>/oradata DB 11.1 and 11.2
